intro: Meibomia triflora var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture due to the dense pubescence. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often found in moist, shaded areas.
